messages: 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:31): It looks like there are some details of Unicode handling that don't work quite the same in Gecko/WebKit between Windows and Linux.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:31): Annoying.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:41): Turns out the Windows behavior is more correct, as it happens.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:43): The result of today's work: https://dvcs.w3.org/hg/editing/rev/8d721ff655d2
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:43): On AWS, how do I check what sort of bill I've run up so far?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:44): I don't seem to see that anywhere.

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:44): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: I wouldn't be surprised if people implemented non-N^2 string append in js for some benchmark and didn't do the same in DOM due to lack of benchmark
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:45): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, sure, but making it not O(n^2) is surely why appendData() and such actually exist . . . oh well.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:45): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: I think there's something on your account information page that links to billing stuff
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:45): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: No reason it has to be n^2 in any case
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:45): but I suppose that's a bit vague
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:46): (Also, I don't know how frequently it's updated)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:46): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, I guess not, if you treat the property magically.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:47): In theory foo.textContent += bar would be O(n^2), since it means foo.textContent = foo.textContent + bar, so you'd have to read textContent every time in full.  But you could cheat on that easily enough.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:47): It'd have to be a special case, though.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:47): appendData() isn't a special case.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:47): Well, whatever.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:47): What I did seems to work, so awesome.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:49): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, wow, they try to make this difficult.
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:50): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: well, depending on the refcounting mechanism, i'd expect...
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:50): rather, GC mechanism

06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:51): for example, CPython can implement nonexponential string appending, because it's refcounted and can tell if anything else has a reference to a string--if not it can avoid making the copy
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:51): other implementations use other GC methods which don't give that information, so they can't make that optimization
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:52): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: billing is "account activity"
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (23:53): looks like they reorganized the console recently--have to click your name in the top-right corner (for some reason)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:08): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: Most JS engines have string implementations that allow a string to be formed of a list of strings.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:09): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: I thing CPython does something more complex.
bdf7d7409da19264fa0c4bf6b4f2d0cc (00:11): JSC and V8 have rope support, i believe
bdf7d7409da19264fa0c4bf6b4f2d0cc (00:11): fuzzy on the details
bdf7d7409da19264fa0c4bf6b4f2d0cc (00:11): but that isn't necessarily useful in the DOM implementation
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:11): bdf7d7409da19264fa0c4bf6b4f2d0cc: It won't be useful at all in the DOM impl
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:11): bdf7d7409da19264fa0c4bf6b4f2d0cc: Carakan does too
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:11): bdf7d7409da19264fa0c4bf6b4f2d0cc: And I'd be amazed if SpiderMonkey didn't
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:13): CPython just goes "if refcount == 1, append in-place", i think

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:13): bdf7d7409da19264fa0c4bf6b4f2d0cc: Actually, no, we don't have ropes. We have something even ligher-weight that effectively is just lazyly evaluated concatenation
bdf7d7409da19264fa0c4bf6b4f2d0cc (00:13): yeah, there are many ways to skin that cat
bdf7d7409da19264fa0c4bf6b4f2d0cc (00:13): with the desired properties
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:14): Lazely evaluating it keeps many of the O(1) properties of strings, at least
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:25): wonders how many ways a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 can misspell "lazily"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:27): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Lots.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (00:50): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: what details? Gecko doesn't use much from the underlying platform so I'd be surprised
b844a0a98f81c321afe1d38ae37f3c28 (00:54): channel #whatwg

25812bf456959aa5f28dc570f341a3ba (00:54): is 'WHATWG: http://www.whatwg.org/ -- logs: http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/ -- stats: http://gavinsharp.com/irc/whatwg.html -- Please leave your sense of logic at the door, thanks!'
5d5b78699e57104f2fa03bbdf7b9197b (00:54): by annevk42 on Mon Oct 19 23:03:06
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (01:17): https://encrypted.google.com/ ... why is google drawing an arrow pointing at an empty space? heh
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (01:18): "dude, the corner of your monitor is pretty cool"?
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (01:19): i think that's where the google plus thingy shows up when you are logged in
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (01:20): there's something there in the non-https version of that page
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (01:20): but i don't use google.com, i use encrypted.google.com
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (01:20): smells like poor testing practices for the front page of google's flagship product, heh :P
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (01:21): on google.com it points at "Web" (which is where you already are)
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (01:22): (and clicking it says "hey, you wasted your time clicking this since g+ is broken on gapps accounts")

e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (01:29): don't be sad. sadness leads to poor digestion. poor digestion leads to fear. Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering. And more poor digestion.
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (01:30): i'd be less sad if google's main search page would stop intentionally distracting users from what they came to search for D:
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (01:31): i've never ran gdb and had it load pacman
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (01:34): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: I filed a bug -- does that make you feel a bit better? :)
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (01:35): on gdb asking for pacman? D:
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (01:35): the frontpage stuff usually only lasts a couple days so it's sort of a self-expiring bug :)
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (01:35): > call pacman
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (01:41): eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee: I honestly don't know why I did that.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (02:13): TabAtkins, so by "concrete object" do you mean "box" or do you mean something else?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (02:13): TabAtkins, I was assuming you meant "box".
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (02:13): is wondering whether to introduce cement objects and bricks
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (02:14): cinder blocks
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (02:20): I should probably just unsubscribe from www-style.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (02:20): It's full of people arguing about things that nobody's even said or written down anywhere.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (02:33): just be selective about which threads you read
